Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Five beads
Description: Here is a set of five beads found in the same tomb. One of the beads is round, made of blue glass and is pierced through its centre (exterior diametre: 0,85 cm, thickness: 0,5 cm). The four other beads are of a similar type: a round, flat one made of green enamel with an indented edge and pierced longitudinally (diametre: 0,7 cm, thickness: 0,2 cm) and three rectangular ones - two of green enamel (length between 0,8 and 0,9 cm, width: 0,7 cm, thickness:0,25 cm) and one of yellow enamel (length: 0,9 cm, width 0,8 cm, thickness: 0,3 cm) - also indented along the edge and pierced through their lengths.
